metadata.Title: CVE-2020-27786 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: A flaw was found in the Linux kernelâ€™s implementation of MIDI, where an attacker with a local account and the permissions to issue ioctl commands to midi devices could trigger a use-after-free issue. A write to this specific memory while freed and before use causes the flow of execution to change and possibly allow for memory corruption or privilege escalation. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to confidentiality, integrity, as well as system availability.

notes.Note: cascardo> commit 39675f7a7c7e7702f7d5341f1e0d01db746543a0 would be a pre-req.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needs-triage ESM criteria').
